description.narrative: Insecurity is an impediment to Afghanistan's development and security costs comprising the single largest share of Afghanistan's budget. In 2012, Australia and the international community made a commitment to assist Afghanistan in financing its security costs for the period 2015 to 2020. Australia's annual US$100 million 'Chicago' commitment is split between the Department of Defence for the NATO Afghan National Army and Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) for the Afghan National Police (ANP). In 2015, DFAT directed its support for the ANP through the Law and Order Trust Fund for Afghanistan (LOTFA), managed by the United Nations Development Programme. In conjunction with the Afghan Ministries of Finance and Internal Affairs, LOTFA administers the payment of police salaries under a broader program of police professionalisation and institutional reform. The total value of this investment is $185.5 million over 5 years, starting 2015-16.
